data.title: Implemented tab duplicate. fixes #25563
data.body:
The commit does the following:

1. Adds a new _Duplicate_ entry to the active tab context menu when is a text editor (it also comes with a ⌘K + ⌘U keyboard shortcut).
2. When a tab is duplicated a new Tab is created with the same text, language and cursor position.

data.title: JS Syntax highlight snafu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:24:39.530Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
solidity|Jua|0.0.29
vscode-jest|Ort|2.3.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
code-clip-ring|Sir|0.0.4
Bookmarks|ale|0.16.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
python|don|0.7.0
json-tools|eri|1.0.2
prettier-vscode|esb|0.23.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. put the following code in a JS file
```
export let foo = (type, { ids = [], 
  page = 0}) => {
  console.log(type, ids, page);
}
```

2. See how the syntax highlighting is broken. Specifically seems to be the lf after the ids = [], that triggers the issue

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes


Bad:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4623/30883907-b2e6b6b6-a2db-11e7-9456-4962e95a3283.png)

Good: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4623/30883920-c058f03e-a2db-11e7-9179-aa9eab070cef.png)

data.title: FileSystemWatcher based on RelativePattern does not fire
how to set php.validate.executablePath if I want to use php on Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)
data.body:
I am trying WSL and vscode. I would like to use php that I installed on wsl  with vs code. I used [this ](https://github.com/Microsoft/BashOnWindows/issues/1946#issuecomment-295583000)solution to add php into windows path but I am not sure how set php.validate.executablePath in this scenario. is this possible? can anyone help please?

Thanks.

I'm not sure if a new build just hasn't been pushed out in the last 6 days or if the updater is broken in my install.  It would appear that I'm using a build that was pushed on on 9/20, and when I check for updates it states there are no updates available.

Without being able to determine the latest actual released build it's hard to know if there is a problem or not.  If that information is _not_ currently available somewhere it might be a good idea to post it somewhere.

data.title: Once debug test failed due to an exception, the "debug test" and "run test" links are gone.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:24:39.530Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
githistory|don|0.2.3
python|don|0.7.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0
gitblame|wad|2.2.0
---
Once debug test failed due to an exception, the "debug test" and "run test" links are gone. Have to restart VS Code to be able to debug again.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a unit test which fail or throw an exception.
2. Click debug test link and let it run to finish.
3. Try debug the test again, but there is no links to "debug test" or "run test"

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Typescript - Generates imports with double quotes, immediately suggests using single quotes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:24:33.599Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
angular-cli|pko|1.0.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a typescript file and class where you reference a missing using.
2. Use the refactoring tools to generate the import statement.

The generated code is:
   `import { HarmonyService } from "./harmony-service";`
But VSCode immediately suggests fix: " should be '.

It should probably just have generated 
    `import { HarmonyService } from './harmony-service';`

- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18

quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.66
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0

vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
vscode-instant-markdown|dba|1.3.0
gitlens|eam|5.2.0
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1
vscode-great-icons|emm|2.1.16
vscode-styled-components|jpo|0.0.8
vscode-ai|ms-|0.1.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.0
vetur|oct|0.9.10
proto|pet|0.0.2
vscode-versionlens|pfl|0.19.1
polymer-ide|pol|0.6.0
testcafe-test-runner|rom|1.2.0
google-input-tools|var|0.0.3
vscode-import-cost|wix|2.5.0
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.5.0
ReactSnippets|xab|1.4.0



---

This is a feature request. I would like to have a first class API to play with TouchBar. Perhaps, a subset of whatever Electron offers. I feel its very restrictive to have access to TouchBar via `contribution points` only. I wrote an extension which uses `completionProvider` and I want my suggestions to show up on TouchBar. This is not possible currently with the support added in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14653

data.title: wrappingIndent not consistently working
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6 (Sierra)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a large file or create one
2. Use these settings: 

 ```
    "atomKeymap.promptV3Features": true,
    "editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrlCmd",
    "editor.formatOnPaste": true,
    "editor.fontSize": 14,
    "editor.wordWrap": "on",
    "editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter": "off",
    "workbench.activityBar.visible": true,
    "terminal.external.osxExec": "iterm.app",
    "window.zoomLevel": 1,
    "workbench.sideBar.location": "left",
    "workbench.statusBar.visible": true,
    "extensions.ignoreRecommendations": false,
    "editor.dragAndDrop": false,
    "editor.links": false,
    "bracketPairColorizer.forceUniqueOpeningColor": true,
    "bracketPairColorizer.forceIterationColorCycle": true,
    "bracketPairColorizer.consecutivePairColors": [
        ...
    ],
    "editor.fontFamily": "Input",
    "editor.fontWeight": "100",
    "editor.wrappingIndent": "indent",
    "editor.wordWrapColumn": 100
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Here's an image that illustrates the inconsistencies (sorry I had to block some things out):
[Screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/txkGPe6.jpg)

As you can see, all the things at the bottom of the editor are wrapping and indenting correctly, but many lines above are wrapping and not indenting at all. Sometimes they wrap, sometimes they don't. It's even more inconsistent (and impossible to work with) if I have the file explorer open (can provide another screenshot if needed, but honestly, it's impossible to tell what's going on as indentation is so all over the place).

This happens whether I have editor.wrappingIndent set to indent or same, and without extensions loaded. It's very frustrating and can make some files a huge PITA to edit (it seems that after about 5 indentations things get weird, and almost everything I'm working with is in the 8-20 indentation range).

Edit: after playing around, it seems the wrappingIndent definitely breaks at 10 indents every time, but the presence of anything over 9 indents seems to cause the weird inconsistencies with other lines/indent amounts. This, again, becomes painfully hard to deal with if the file explorer is open.

Open the Extensions viewlet and search multiple times
The keyboard shortcut for search history (Alt Up/Down)  results in navigating the search results

Along with navigating the search results, the lines in the editor move up and down too

data.title: Launch TypeScript out-of-the-box
data.body:
Testing #34993

AKA "F5 a TypeScript file".

An old idea, but: Would it be possible to run a task without a `tasks.json` on disk? Similar to launching a debug session without having a `launch.json` on disk? Could we then have an in-memory launch config with a preLaunchTask that compiles the currently open `.ts` file?

Maybe not much has changed since this came up last, but I thought I'd ask. Other languages might also benefit from a solution, if it is generic enough.

data.title: Emmet commands should not show in command palette for virtual text documents
data.body:
**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open release notes in the editor
2. Look for `Emmet` in the command palette

**Bug**
These commands only apply when there is an active text editor. They should not show up for virtual text documents

data.title: accessibility: allow me to jump quickly to various debugger treeviews
data.body:
As a keyboard only user, I'd like to quickly be able to jump to the variables, or watch area of the debugger.

1. I press f5 to start debugging. A breakpoint is hit, I am placed on the line. If I want to investigate the variables, breakpoints, or call stack, I have to control+shift+d, then tab several times. Then, I press f11 to step in, or f5 to continue, ...
2. Now, my cursor is thrown into the editor, and I have to repeat those multiple tabs to get back to the variables/call stack/watching.

I propose a keyboard shortcut to quickly ump to the variables area, and/or making it possible to move between the debugger areas with less keystrokes if possible (By putting buttons into toolbars I can arrow along).

data.title: Explorer does not navigate to current file on first open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (a5210bcbda97166904ce4c08ee296cb98fccfcd9, 2017-09-26T05:15:18.286Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-21-generic
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode in the [DefinitelyTyped](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped) repository.
2. Open `abs/index.d.ts` and `zip.js/index.d.ts` as tabs.
3. Close the explorer (View -> Toggle side bar)
4. Observe that when you re-open the explorer (View -> Explorer), you're navigated to whatever file you're currently editing.
5. Now close the explorer and exit vscode.
6. Now open the explorer again. You're not navigated to the current file.

This worked in vscode `1.16.1`.

data.title: VS Code unusable on Mac with large projects

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.16.1 (1.16.1)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4 (16E195)

Opening a large project in VS Code on Mac causes other in-no-way-related programs to crash, break, or behave otherwise unexpectedly. Examples include Safari and Chrome failing to load anything, Terminal failing to even show a basic prompt, and even VS Code's Git extension failing to initialize. VS Code continues to work, until you try to save, at which point it fails to do so. Makes it unworkable for large projects.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create project with large number of files. My project currently has 20k+ files (that does not include npm modules BUT it does include build artifacts).
2. Observe (in Activity Monitor for example) a high thread count. It currently floats around 660 threads for me. If using Activity Monitor, observe the number of open files by CodeHelper (gets up to around 9k before crashing the log.)
3. Observe other programs failing. This includes basically every program -- browsers failing to load despite having internet, other IDEs, Terminal, Chrome extensions, even VS Code's Git extension fails.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Open recently closed tab/file
data.body: Same as in a web browser, is it awesome to reopen tabs in visual studio code.

data.title: VSCode opens off-screen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:09.760Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-sidebar|Acr|1.0.0
yaml|ada|0.0.9

---

Steps to Reproduce:

I have a Surface tablet with two external monitors. This problem has popped up recently, because it used to work and now it doesn't. I don't know if it's a problem with Windows or with VSCode. It affects VSCode and PowerShell ISE.

1. Open VSCode.
2. Drag the window to one of the external monitors.
3. Close VSCode. 

Next time you open it, it will be off the screen and you won't be able to see it. I know it's off-screen because when you click on the icon a couple of times, you can see it minimizing it and then reopening it off-screen. 

To make it appear again, you have choices.
1. Disconnect the external monitors, at which point Windows moves all open Windows to the Surface tablet. Reconnect the external monitors and move all the windows back to where they were. 
2. Make sure the window is selected, click Alt+Space, M, then use the arrows to move it down until you can see it. 

Also, you can make sure you drag the last open VSCode window back to the Surface tablet before closing it. Then next time you open it, it will appear there and you can drag it back to the external monitor. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No
I don't know. Seems hard to believe that a YAML extension would cause a problem with the application showing up within the screen boundaries.
